description: A minimal Kanban board for personal productivity tracking that reads from prd.json to display features and user stories in a Linear-inspired interface

userStories.title: Initialize Next.js project with TypeScript and Tailwind
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to set up the project foundation so I can build the application with the chosen tech stack.
acceptanceCriteria: Next.js 14+ project initialized with TypeScript
Tailwind CSS configured and working
Basic folder structure created (components, lib, types)
Project runs with `npm run dev`
Typecheck passes (`npm run typecheck` or `npx tsc --noEmit`)

userStories.title: Define TypeScript types for PRD data structure
userStories.description: As a developer, I need TypeScript types that match the prd.json schema so I have type safety throughout the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Types defined for Feature, UserStory, and PRD root
UserStory includes: id, title, description, acceptanceCriteria, priority, passes, startedAt, completedAt, durationSeconds, notes
Feature includes: id, name, branchName, dependsOn, userStories array
PRD root includes: project, description, features array
Types exported from a central types file (types/prd.ts)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create API route to read prd.json
userStories.description: As a developer, I need an API endpoint that reads and returns the prd.json data so the frontend can fetch it.
acceptanceCriteria: GET `/api/prd` endpoint returns parsed prd.json contents
Reads from fixed path `./prd.json` in project root
Returns 200 with JSON data when file exists and is valid
Returns appropriate error response when file is missing or invalid
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create utility for human-readable time formatting
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a utility function to convert seconds into human-readable time so it's displayed consistently throughout the app.
acceptanceCriteria: Function takes durationSeconds (number) as input
Returns formatted string (e.g., '2h 15m', '45m', '1h')
Handles edge cases: 0 seconds, null/undefined, very large numbers
Unit tests cover various inputs
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Create empty state component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see helpful instructions when prd.json is missing or empty so I know how to get started.
acceptanceCriteria: Empty state component displays when no prd.json exists
Shows clear message explaining the file is missing
Includes brief instructions on expected file location
Styled consistently with app theme (neutral colors, centered layout)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Create story card component
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see story information displayed on cards so I can quickly understand each story's details.
acceptanceCriteria: Card displays story ID and title prominently
Card shows story description (truncated if long)
Card shows time spent in human-readable format (e.g., '2h 15m') for completed stories using the time formatting utility
Card has visual indicator for status (color-coded: gray for backlog, blue for in-progress, green for done)
Card is responsive and works on mobile
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Create Kanban column component
userStories.description: As a user, I want stories grouped into columns by status so I can see the workflow at a glance.
acceptanceCriteria: Column component displays header with status name
Column shows count of stories (e.g., 'Backlog (5)')
Column renders list of story cards
Three columns supported: Backlog, In Progress, Done
Columns are scrollable when content overflows
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Create feature group component with progress bar
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see features grouped with their stories and a progress bar so I can track completion at the feature level.
acceptanceCriteria: Feature header shows feature name
Progress bar shows completion ratio (e.g., 3 of 5 stories)
Progress bar visually indicates percentage complete with colored fill
Feature groups its stories within the Kanban columns
Works with multiple features on the same board
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Build main Kanban board page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see all features and stories in a Kanban board layout so I can visualize my project progress.
acceptanceCriteria: Board page fetches data from `/api/prd`
Displays all features grouped on the board
Shows three status columns with stories distributed correctly based on passes field (passes=false && no startedAt = backlog, passes=false && startedAt = in-progress, passes=true = done)
Shows empty state when no data available
Page is the default route (`/`)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Implement auto-refresh functionality
userStories.description: As a user, I want the board to automatically refresh so I see updates without manually reloading the page.
acceptanceCriteria: Board polls for updates every 30 seconds
Updates display without full page reload
No visual flicker during refresh
Polling interval defined as constant that can be adjusted
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Create list view with expandable feature sections
userStories.description: As a user, I want an alternative list view with features as expandable sections so I can see details in a more compact format.
acceptanceCriteria: List view shows features as expandable/collapsible sections
Each section header shows feature name and progress (X of Y)
Expanded section shows all stories with ID, title, status, time spent
Stories are visually distinguished by status (color indicators)
Sections remember expanded/collapsed state during session
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add view toggle (Board/List)
userStories.description: As a user, I want to switch between board and list views so I can choose my preferred way to see the data.
acceptanceCriteria: Toggle control visible in page header area
Toggle switches between Kanban board and list view
Current view preference persists in local storage
Smooth transition between views
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Implement light/dark mode toggle
userStories.description: As a user, I want to switch between light and dark themes so I can use the app comfortably in different lighting conditions.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme toggle button in header area
Dark mode has appropriate color scheme (dark backgrounds #0d1117, light text)
Light mode has appropriate color scheme (light backgrounds, dark text)
Theme preference saved to local storage
Respects system preference on first load
All components properly themed
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Add page header with project info
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see the project name and overall progress in a header so I have context for what I'm viewing.
acceptanceCriteria: Header shows project name from prd.json
Header shows overall progress (total stories complete / total stories)
Header includes view toggle and theme toggle controls
Header is sticky/fixed on scroll
Header is responsive on mobile
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Make board fully mobile-responsive
userStories.description: As a user, I want to use the board on my phone so I can check progress anywhere.
acceptanceCriteria: Board columns scroll horizontally on mobile with snap points
Cards are readable and tappable on small screens
Header and controls adapt to mobile viewport
List view works well on mobile
Touch interactions work smoothly
Tested at 375px width (iPhone SE)
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill
